Element Class Reference
UI Elements

Element Class. More...

#include <Element.hpp>

Inheritance diagram for Element:

Detailed Description

An Element is a basic building block of the UI. Elements are designed to be scalable so they can be adjusted to different screen sizes so that Apps based on elements are future proof.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator
ENTER 

Enter the element (ie, transition to the Element)

UPDATE 

Update the element (executed periodically while Element is drawing)

SETUP 

Setup the element (called at program startup.

TOP_PRESS 

Press and release top button.

TOP_HOLD 

Press and hold for Button::long_press duration.

LEFT_PRESS 

Press and release left button.

LEFT_HOLD 

Press and hold left button (see Button::long_press)

CENTER_HOLD 

Press and hold center button (see Button::long_press)

RIGHT_PRESS 

Press and release the right button.

RIGHT_HOLD

mg_int_t  x,
mg_int_t  y 
)
virtual

This method draws the element on the specified bitmap

Parameters
bA pointer to the destination bitmap
xX offset in element coordinates (percentage of screen width; see Element::scale)
yY offset in element coordinates (percentage of screen height; see Element::scale)
centerIf true object will be centered at x
Returns
The screen dimensions where the element was drawn

virtual Element* Element::event_handler ( int  event)
virtual

This method is called on the current Element when an event (e.g., Element::ENTER, Element::UPDATE, Element::TOP_PRESS) happens.

Parameters
eventThe event to execute
Returns
For transitions, the new element is returned; otherwise this

Reimplemented in ListItemElement, ListItemCallback, ListItemCheck, ListItemToggle, MorseInput, ButtonBar, Map, List, MapMenu, MessageList, Text, Screen, Edit, and Discover.

static element_size_t Element::scale ( )
inlinestatic

This value determines how all objects are scaled. The default value is 100. This means a value of 50 is half the target bitmap. For example, by default the following code sets the element dimensions to be half the size of the target bitmap.

#include <fogo/Ui/Label.hpp>
Label l;
l.set_dim(50,50);

To get better resolution, the scale value can be increased. For example:

#include <fogo/Ui/Label.hpp>
Element::set_scale(1000); //this will apply to all elements in the application
Label l;
l.set_dim(500,500); //sets dimensions to half the size of the target bitmap
